page.title: 08SOUTHAMPTON COMMON 2
page.content: Apart from its more obvious recreational function, the Common provides an interesting habitat with a variety of wildlife. Many varieties of birds may be observed including owls and woodpeckers as well as water fowl on the cemetry lake. Foxes live in the area and are regularly seen in early morning risking their lives by crossing the busy Avenue. A small Field Studies centre has been established and this arranges study facilities for schools and other interested bodies. Unfortunately, the area also attracts some of the less desirable humans, who, whether through drug or alchohol abuse, often pose a threat to others who spoil the amenity by graffiti or vandalism. (dossers)
